title: The Rise of Arena Rock
description: A fast breakdown of The Rise of Arena Rock for builders.

hook.text: In the 1970s, rock bands got so big they needed stadiums instead of clubs.

buildup.text: Bands like Queen, KISS, and Aerosmith built massive stage shows with pyrotechnics.

discovery.text: Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody proved a six-minute opera could become a stadium anthem.

twist.text: Critics hated arena rock's excess â€” but fans filled 80,000-seat venues every night.

climax.text: Live performance became spectacle, and rock became the world's biggest entertainment.

punchline.text: The music got louder because the rooms got bigger.

quiz.question: What defined arena rock in the 1970s?
options: Massive stage shows in stadiums with pyrotechnics
